term.title: ion-exchange polymer

item.text: Polymer that is able to exchange ions (cations or anions) with ionic components in solution.

notes.item: An ion-exchange polymer in ionized form may also be referred to as a polyanion or a polycation.
Synthetic ion-exchange organic polymers are often network polyelectrolytes.
A membrane having ion-exchange groups is called an ion-exchange membrane.
Use of the term 'ion-exchange resin' for 'ion-exchange polymer' is strongly discouraged.

sources.item: PAC, 2004, 76, 889. 'Definitions of terms relating to reactions of polymers and to functional polymeric materials (IUPAC Recommendations 2003)' on page 895 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac200476040889)
